Text: A foreign language is originally from another country.

<Text: Foreign language:  It is also a language not spoken in the native country of the person referred to, i.e., an English speaker living in Spain can say that Spanish is a foreign language to him or her.>

Triplet:<Foreign
language not spoken in the native country

Text: Foreign language:  These two characterisations do not exhaust the possible definitions, however, and the label is occasionally applied in ways that are variously misleading or factually inaccurate.
